snippet: The incident involving Ozzie Guillen exposed just how volatile the issue of Fidel Castro’s reign remains in Miami among the nation’s largest population of Cuban immigrants.
abstract: Miami Marlins suspend manager Ozzie Guillen for making remarks about how much he admires and respects longtime Cuban dictator Fidel Castro; Guillen holds a press conference apologizing for his comments; the incident exposes just how enduring and volatile the issue of Castro's reign remains in Miami, which has the nation's largest population of Cuban immigrants, as well as how reliant the Marlins are on the Cuban-American community as a fan base.

byline.original: By EDGAR THOMPSON AND JULIET MACUR
byline.contributor: Edgar Thompson reported from Miami and Juliet Macur from New York. Richard Sandomir contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The incident involving Ozzie Guillen exposed just how volatile the issue of Fidel Castro’s reign remains in Miami among the nation’s largest population of Cuban immigrants.

headline.seo: Marlins Suspend Manager for Pro-Castro Comments
headline.main: In Miami, Winning Clearly Isn’t the Only Thing
headline.print_headline: In Miami, Winning Clearly Isn’t the Only Thing
